title: Indian Wrestlers Demand Action:  Top Athletes Call for Removal of WFI Chief Amidst Sexual Harassment Allegations
content:
India's top wrestlers, including Vinesh Phogat, Bajrang Punia, Sakshi Malik, Ravi Dahiya, and Deepak Punia, have written to Indian Olympic Association (IOA) president PT Usha, demanding the removal of Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh. 

The wrestlers, who have been protesting against Singh, allege sexual harassment and financial misconduct within the federation. They have also accused Singh of "mentally harassing and torturing" Phogat after her performance at the Tokyo Olympics.

The wrestlers have demanded an immediate investigation into the allegations, Singh's resignation, and the dissolution of the WFI. They also called for a new committee to be formed to run the federation in consultation with athletes. The IOA has promised a thorough investigation and the formation of a special committee to address such issues in the future.
